title: Neurobiology of Learning and Memory
description: This course provides an overview of the neurobiology of learning and memory, from cognitive to molecular neuroscience, including human, animal, cellular, and molecular studies of memory. Topics include amnesia, intellectual disability, exceptional intelligence, aging, and Alzheimer’s disease. Prerequisites: upper-division standing and BILD 12 or COGS 107B or COGS 17 or PSYC 106 or PSYC 181 or PSYC 181GS or PSYC 2.
